curated_text: Symbol: APD. Year: 2022. Period: Q2. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense, Air Products, the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, Air Products Brasil Ltda, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, Amines, the Florida Department of Environmental Protection, the United States Environmental Protection Agency, the Consent Order, FDEP, USEPA, the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control, SCDHEC, the Record of Decision, Pasadena, PUI, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality, RCRA, treasury, Pension, Total Balance, EPS, Air Products', Lu’An Clean Energy Company, • Americas, • Corporate, Corporate, Industrial Gases, Business Segment Americas Asia Europe, India Corporate, Total Three Months Ended, Contents Americas Asia Europe Middle East, 653.0 Equity, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Liquidity and Capital Resources 54, Critical Accounting Policies, SEC, Business Segment Information, Supplemental Information, the Jazan Integrated Gasification, Power Company, Impacts Underlying, Impacts Equity, 0.05 Noncontrolling, Adjusted Diluted EPS From Continuing Operations, Non-GAAP Measures Adjusted, Sales % Change, Euro, the U.S. Dollar, Administrative Selling, Research and Development Research, Exchange, Joint Venture Partner, the Tyczka Group, JIGPC, Non-Operating Income (Expense, Segment Analysis Americas, Total Americas Sales Change, LNG, Air Products Qudra, Jazan Gas Project Company, 72.8 Interest, Performance Materials Division, % Total Americas Sales Change, Air Products Diluted, Sales Americas Asia Europe Middle East, Americas Asia Europe, the U.S., 76.1 Facility, Capital Expenditures, Capital Expenditures Capital, Credit Facilities, Credit Agreement, Equity Securities, the Board of Directors, The Board of Directors, ESTIMATES Management’s Discussion and Analysis, Basis of Presentation, Major Accounting Policies, U.S. Dollar, Foreign Currency Exchange. Context excerpt: competition, environmental, intellectual property, regulatory, product liability, and insurance matters. We do not currently believe there are any legal proceedings, individually or in the aggregate, that are reasonably possible to have a material impact on our financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows. In September 2010, the Brazilian Administrative Council for Economic Defense ("CADE") issued a decision against our Brazilian subsidiary, Air Products Brasil Ltda., and several other Brazilian industrial gas companies for alleged anticompetitive activities. CADE imposed a civil fine of R$ 179.2 million (approximately $ 38 at 31 March 2022) on Air Products Brasil Ltda. This fine was based on a recommendation by a unit of the Brazilian Ministry of Justice, following an investigation beginning in 2003, which alleged violation of competition laws with respect to the sale of industrial and medical gases. The fines are based on a percentage of our total revenue in Brazil in 20
